message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.NE 

This paper is primarily focused on evaluating the performance of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) on image classification tasks, specifically in managing nuisance transformations such as location and scale variability. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper discusses the impact of context on classification tasks, which could also fall under cs.MM (Multimedia). The paper also proposes improved sampling techniques, which could be related to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper uses empirical evidence to draw conclusions about the effectiveness of CNNs, which could also be relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning).
